output_requirements.format: Markdown document with all sections below (or adapt to preferred format)
output_requirements.scope: Comprehensive product specification for the product

core_philosophy: Designed as a mission control / command center for the core domain/problem — NOT a traditional replacement for existing tools unless explicitly required
Prioritize intuitive, visual-first interfaces where appropriate (graphs, flows, dashboards, simulations over pure text)
Every major feature should enable observability, feedback loops, and trust
Transparency: key decisions and system behavior must be inspectable/explainable
Scale-native design: built to handle realistic production volumes from early design (quantity, throughput, concurrency appropriate to domain)
strict_structure: Problem Statement (highest priority — what the product solves)
Key Features (organized by Phase 1/2/3 or equivalent milestones)
core_rules: Domain-native from day 1: design around the primary usage scale and patterns
Observable system behavior: show users what the system/agents/components are doing (progress, decisions, costs, errors)
Closed feedback loops: observe → act → observe results → iterate
Visual-first where it adds clarity: prioritize visual representations over text when effective
Transparency & inspectability: avoid black boxes for critical decisions
Phase clarity: clearly separate MVP from later expansions
Real-time where appropriate: plan for timely updates from early design

1_document_overview.purpose: 1–2 sentences: What is the product and why does it exist?
assumptions: Key assumptions about users, infrastructure, dependencies, etc.

2_problem_statement.context: How is the world/domain changing? Why does this product matter now?

persona_template.name: Primary / Secondary / Tertiary Persona Name
persona_template.demographics: Age range, experience level, role, background
persona_template.usage_scenario: Typical / high-value way they would use the product

4_key_features.phase_organization: Phase 1 (MVP / Immediate Urgency), Phase 2 (High Urgency), Phase 3 (Medium Urgency / Scale & Polish)

key_capabilities: Bulleted list of what users can do
success_metrics: How do we know this works? (measurable if possible)
supporting_components: What backend/system/agent/other parts must do to enable this (if applicable)

6_mvp_success_criteria: etc. (must be met to consider MVP done)
